id.description: Each location must have a unique identifier

latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier.
Each service must have a unique identifier.
Each organization must have a unique identifier.

name.description: The official or public name of the organization.

description.description: A brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.

email.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

url.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

logo.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization.

name.description: The official or public name of the service.

status.description: The current status of the service.

fees.description:
Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

Application Profile Notes: Use structured information where available in preference to this text field.

accreditations.description:
Details of any accreditations. Accreditation is the formal evaluation of an organization or program against best practice standards set by an accrediting organization.

Application Profile Notes: Use structured information where available in preference to this text field.

deliverable_type.description: A categorisation of the nature of the output of the Service.

assured_date.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked

id.description: Each physical address must have a unique identifier.

address_1.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

city.description: The city in which the address is located.

state_province.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

postal_code.description: The postal code for the address.

country.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation).

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

accessibility.description: Description of assistance or infrastructure that facilitate access to clients with disabilities.

id.description: Each taxonomy entry must have a unique identifier. If combining multiple taxonomies with overlapping identifiers, use a prefix to distinguish them.

name.description: The name of this taxonomy term or category.

vocabulary.description: If this is an established taxonomy, detail which taxonomy is in use. For example, AIRS or Open Eligibility.
